definition: surname Mi/name of an ancient state
(used for transliteration)/old variant of 謳|讴[ou1]
Europe/abbr. for 歐洲|欧洲[Ou1 zhou1]/surname Ou
Romeo and Juliet, 1594 tragedy by William Shakespeare 莎士比亞|莎士比亚
pinyin: Luo2 mi4 ou1 yu3 Zhu1 li4 ye4
A1 er3 fa3 · Luo2 mi4 ou1

sentences.english: Right now I feel like Romeo when he first saw Julieta.
sentences.chinese: 眼前，我有了罗密欧初次遇见朱丽叶的那种感觉。

sentences.english: Romeo stared blankly at the dead body at his feet.
sentences.chinese: 罗密欧茫然地瞪视著他脚边的尸体。

sentences.english: I loved working on Romeo and Juliet.
sentences.chinese: 我喜爱的“罗密欧与茱丽叶”的工作。

sentences.english: We are going to movies. Romeo and Juliet.
sentences.chinese: 我们要去看电影《罗密欧与朱丽叶》。
我喜欢《罗密欧与朱莉叶》。

sentences.english: The exchange of your love's faithful vow(voto fedele)for mine.
sentences.chinese: 罗密欧你还异国把你的爱情的忠厚的盟誓跟我互换。

sentences.english: And it’s not just the chemicals in the brain that cosh your resident Romeo.
sentences.chinese: 不只是大脑中的化学物质让你的罗密欧沉睡。

sentences.english: This is the script of the play of"Romio and Juliet".
sentences.chinese: 这是剧本“罗密欧和朱丽叶”的原稿。

sentences.english: Jaco: We are going to movies. Romeo and Juliet.
sentences.chinese: 我们要去看电影《罗密欧与朱丽叶》。

sentences.english: Romeo wanted to speak out, but waited for her to say more.
sentences.chinese: 罗密欧很想出声说话，但他等待茱丽叶把话说完。

sentences.english: "Do you know the story of Romeo and Julieta?" I asked.
sentences.chinese: “你知道罗密欧与朱丽叶的故事吗”，我问道。

sentences.english: Romeo & Juliet, Julius Caesar, The Merchant of Venice.
sentences.chinese: 罗密欧与朱丽叶，恺撒大帝，威尼斯商人。

sentences.english: Her neck was covered with zits after her date with that Romeo.
sentences.chinese: 在跟那罗密欧约会后，她的脖子上满布吻痕。

sentences.english: Benvolio, nephew to Montague, and friend to Romeo.
sentences.chinese: 班弗里奥，蒙太古的侄子及罗密欧的朋友。

sentences.english: Romeo: Have not saints lips, and holy palmers too?
sentences.chinese: 罗密欧圣人和信徒没有嘴唇吗？

sentences.english: Romeo, the son of the Montague family, also goes to the party.
sentences.chinese: 罗密欧，蒙太古家的儿子也去了那个舞会。

definition: Beckenham or Beckham (name)/David Beckham (1975-), British midfield footballer
"Becks", nickname of British footballer David Beckham (see 貝克漢姆|贝克汉姆[Bei4 ke4 han4 mu3])
